author: M Soundariya Preetha
text:
Representatives of the trade and industry have welcomed the announcement on Coimbatore being selected as one of the 20 cities for the Smart City project. The associations have come forward to support the project with suggestions and even in implementation of the project.

Rajesh Lund, president of CREDAI – Coimbatore, said being selected for the Smart City project should do a lot of good for the city in terms of better infrastructure. The Indian Green Building Council can give its inputs to make the city greener and support people who take up green initiatives.

There could be tax incentives or relaxation on FSI. There should be citizen participation in all the projects. The services and quality of life should improve for the public.

According to Manimaran, chairperson of Institute of Indian Interior Designers, a city can be smarter even without IT-based systems. There should be a landmark for the city – be it an area, building or a structure. Have transparent systems and ensure that the construction activity is affordable, is our aim.
title: Industry welcomes announcement
